results.title: Sunshine [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Istvan Szabo, Robert Lantos, Andras Hamori and Serendipity Point Films
results.brief_description: Sunshine is an epic drama that follows the lives of three generations of Hungarian Jews from the late 18th century to the 19th century. Ralph Fiennes plays three different roles in this film which begins with the Grandfather developing a tonic that becomes the family’s fortune. The family will experience much pain and heartbreak, mostly due to the invasion of the Nazi’s and some family members conversion from Jewish to Catholic - events that could lead to a family’s demise. “Sunshine” shows how determination and courage can unite a family through struggle and ensure the survival of future generations.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Istvan Szabo, Robert Lantos, Andras Hamori and Serendipity Point Films

results.title: The Godfather [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Francis Ford Coppola, Albert Ruddy and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Francis Ford Coppola’s epic masterpiece features Oscar winner Marlon Brando as the patriarch of the Corleone family. Coppola paints a chilling portrait of a Sicilian family’s rise and near fall from power in America, and the passage of rites from father to son. He masterfully balances the story between family life and the ugly business of crime in which they are engaged. Based on Mario Puzo’ best selling novel, this graphic and brilliant film garnered ten Academy Award nominations. Cast also includes Al Pacino, James Caan, Robert Duvall, Sterling Hayden and Diane Keaton.

results.title: Dodge City
results.creator_credit: Michael Curtiz and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Michael Curtiz (Mildred Pierce, Casablanca, Angels with dirty faces) directed this star vehicle for Errol Flynn with whom he collaborated the year before on “The Adventures of Robin Hood”. In “Dodge City” Flynn plays Wade Hatton, a successful and scrupulous man who, with a loyal crew in tow, herds buffalo across Texas to various destinations. On one such trip the crew are also protecting settler families headed for Dodge City. The frontier life is depicted as dangerous and corrupt, especially in towns thriving on alcohol, gambling and prostitution. As a town with no sheriff, Dodge City is such a town - violent, lawless and ruled by the local saloon owner who murders any individual that tries to collect on honest debts. As a principled and fearless man, Hatton is implored to be sheriff and clean up Dodge City. Flynn is well cast as Hatton, a charming and handsome cowboy. Oliva de Havilland (who starred as Maid Marion in The Adventures of Robin Hood) plays his love interest Abbie Irving, a schoolteacher and journalist. As a Western intended for the Saturday matinee “Dodge City” is replete with scenes of cattle stampedes, bar room brawls and runaway trains. “Dodge City” features some glorious exterior scenes and was filmed in Technicolour.

results.title: Mulan
results.creator_credit: Tony Bancroft, Barry Cook, Pam Coats and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: Set in ancient China, this animated feature focuses on the adventures of a feisty young woman who rejects marriage in order to become a warrior. When the Emperor conscripts recruits to defend China against the invading Huns, Mulan disguises herself as a man and takes her ailing father’s place in the army. Responding to her prayers, her ancestors send a tiny dragon (voiced by Eddie Murphy) to aid her on her quest. In its adaptation of a traditional Chinese folk tale, and its use of Asian actors to voice the key characters, ‘Mulan’ continues Disney’s attempts in the nineties to invest their animated features with a more ethnically diverse tone. The film also departs from the gender stereotyping that characterised the studio’s animated classics. In its portrayal of the young heroine as both physically and intellectually capable, it tapped into the late nineties explosion of strong feminist characters in film and television, initiated by the success of the television series ‘Xena: Warrior Princess’. Voices include Ming-Na Wen, Lea Salonga, Eddie Murphy, Donny Osmond and Harvey Fierstein.

results.title: East is east
results.creator_credit: Damien O'Donnell, Leslee Udwin, Assassin Films and Film Four International
results.brief_description: Set in a small town in the north of England in 1971 this comedy/drama focuses on the inter-generational and cross-cultural conflicts in a large Anglo-Pakistani family. Patriarch George Kahn’s attempts to instill traditional Pakistani values in his seven young adult children are constantly thwarted— both by his easy going British wife and the siblings’ own ambitions. In their claustrophobically cramped terrace house, anarchy erupts daily with farcical energy. The film takes a more serious turn when Kahn decides to set up arranged marriages for his eldest sons. The fierce resistance he faces from his children and their deep resentment at the fact that he has never acknowledged the reality of their lives force him to confront his own chauvinist nature. Cast includes Om Puri and Linda Bassett.

results.title: Tokyo drifter
results.creator_credit: Seijun Suzuki, Tetsuro Nakagawa and Nikkatsu Kabushiki Kaisha
results.brief_description: The Tokyo drifter is Tetsu, a loyal hit man, given to wearing white suits, living out of his time. Tetsu is drawn by his former employer, now attempting to go straight, into a struggle with a rival gang. This is ostensibly a formula genre (yakuza) film transformed by Suzuki into an absurdist thriller by pushing iconography and conventions to hyperbolic extremes. Also pushed to extremes is the characterisation of the nihilistic hero of the yakuza film (a Japanese hero stripped of traditional codes and rituals) played here by a Japanese teenage idol. According to critic Tadao Sato, Suzuki’s farces have roots not only in early Japanese cinema but also in the comical literature of the Edo period (1765-1831). The stylised violence combines humour and aesthetics in the manner of 19th century kabuki ‘blood festivals’. Cast: Tetsuya Watari, Chieko Matsubara, Tamio Kawaji, Hideaki Nitani, Eiji Goh. In Japanese with English subtitles.

results.title: Branded to kill [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Seijun Suzuki, Kaneo Iwai and Nikkatsu Kabushiki Kaisha
results.brief_description: Hanado Goro, no. 3 gunman in the Tokyo underworld after killing no. 2 and bungling the fourth of a series of imaginatively executed ‘hits’, finds himself playing cat-and-mouse with the dangerous no. 1. Explosions of violence are punctuated by moments of unexpected lyricism and intermingled with bizarre humour (Hanado is sexually aroused by the smell of boiled rice). After making dozens of run-of-the-mill genre films for Nikkatsu, Sejun Suzuki began transforming the banal material assigned to him into farcically hyperbolic absurdist thrillers reinventing the yakuza film by drawing on Japanese comical literary, theatrical and cinematic traditions (see also “Tokyo drifter”), in the process attracting both a cult following and the ire of Nikkatsu. Cast includes Jo Shishido, Koji Nanbara, Isao Tamagawa, Annu Mari, Mariko Ogawa and Hiroshi Minami. In Japanese with English subtitles.

results.title: The Bugs Bunny Road-runner movie
results.creator_credit: Chuck Jones and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: A feature length animated film starring everyone’s favourite rabbit, Bugs Bunny. Living in retirement in his carrot-filled mansion in Beverly Hills, Bugs takes us into his portrait gallery where we are introduced to many famous characters such as Daffy Duck, Porky Pig, Elmer Fudd, Pepe le Pew, Wile E. Coyote and Road-runner, and also some of the important people behind the animation scene including Mel Blanc and Tex Avery. The film is interspersed with excerpts from some of the most classic Chuck Jones cartoons including Duck Dodgers, Robin Hood Daffy, Duck Amuck, What’s Opera Doc? with Bugs as our host throughout the fun-filled chaotic adventures. The final twenty minutes of the film consists of a compilation of Road-runner cartoons edited down into one long manic cartoon chase, featuring of course, that old die-hard Wile E. Coyote and the ever elusive Road-runner. Character voices by Mel Blanc and Arthur Q. Bryan.

results.title: He died with a felafel in his hand
results.creator_credit: Richard Lowenstein, Domenico Procacci, Andrew McPhail and Notorious Films
results.brief_description: Danny (Noah Taylor), onto his 49th share house and in his mid 30s is probably ready for some privacy and independence but is still attracted to the friends and oddball characters that makes sharing a house so attractively horrible. We travel with Danny as he moves through shared houses in Brisbane, Sydney and Melbourne. Danny’s life is further complicated by the presence of rental goons despatched by landlords in search of unpaid rent and the police chasing him in relation to a credit card debt thanks to a dodgy housemate. Proving he is not responsible is harder than lying about his identity. Based on the book of the same name by John Birmingham, `He Died With A Felafel In His Hand’ is a wonderful satire on shared housing. Cast also includes Romane Bohringer, Emily Hamilton, Sophie Lee, Alex Menglet and Damien Walshe Howling.

results.title: My Beautiful laundrette [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Stephen Frears, Sarah Radclyffe, Tim Bevan, Channel Four, SAF Productions and Working Title Films
results.brief_description: Contemporary South London, with its mixture of races, classes and subcultures is the setting for this engaging film written by Hanif Kureishi. Omar is a young Anglo-Asian man on the make who is taken under the wing of his materialistic, and benevolently corrupt, Uncle Nasser. Omar is given a rundown laundromat to manage and he enlists an old school friend, Johnny, who has joined the National Front out of boredom, to help him run the business. Omar and Johnny begin a sexual relationship while around them friends and family try to get by as best they can in the divided society of Thatcherite Britain. One of the most joyous and insightful English films of the eighties. Cast includes Daniel Day Lewis, Saeed Jaffrey and Roshan Seth.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Stephen Frears, Sarah Radclyffe, Tim Bevan, Channel Four, SAF Productions and Working Title Films
results.description: Contemporary South London, with its mixture of races, classes and subcultures is the setting for this engaging film written by Hanif Kureishi. Omar is a young Anglo-Asian man on the make who is taken under the wing of his materialistic, and benevolently corrupt, Uncle Nasser. Omar is given a rundown laundromat to manage and he enlists an old school friend, Johnny, who has joined the National Front out of boredom, to help him run the business. Omar and Johnny begin a sexual relationship while around them friends and family try to get by as best they can in the divided society of Thatcherite Britain. One of the most joyous and insightful English films of the eighties. Cast includes Daniel Day Lewis, Saeed Jaffrey and Roshan Seth.
